description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ete4p","text":"This is a protocol for the preparation of a microscopy sample of single SYTOX Orange molecules on a PLL-coated cover glass. This protocol was used to generate the data shown in Figure 1a, 1b and 1c of the following publication:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":177,"length":14},{"style":"bold","offset":194,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"750fa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d8e76","text":"Bruggeman et al., POLCAM: Instant molecular orientation microscopy for the life sciences. bioRxiv 2023.02.07.527479 (Feb 2023), doi: https://doi.org/10.1101/2023.02.07.527479","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":10,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":97,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":121,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":133,"length":41}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"3734C9D6AEFB11EEAB870A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://doi.org/10.1101/2023.02.07.527479"}}}}
manuscript_citation: {"blocks":[{"key":"37jsv","text":"POLCAM: Instant molecular orientation microscopy for the life sciences","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":70}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9m2rf","text":"Ezra Bruggeman, Oumeng Zhang, Lisa-Maria Needham, Markus Körbel, Sam Daly, Matthew Cheetham, Ruby Peters, Tingting Wu, Andrey S. Klymchenko, Simon J. Davis, Ewa K. Paluch, David Klenerman, Matthew D. Lew, Kevin O’Holleran, Steven F. Lee. bioRxiv 2023.02.07.527479, doi: https://doi.org/10.1101/2023.02.07.527479","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":238,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":270,"length":41}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"3734C9D6AEFB11EEAB870A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://doi.org/10.1101/2023.02.07.527479"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working.

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4mn9i","text":"Argon plasma clean cover glass (VWR collection, 631-0124) for   in a plasma cleaner (Expanded Plasma Cleaner, PDC-002, Harrick Plasma).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":62,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eielq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6jt0t","text":"Create a sample well on the cleaned cover glass by sticking a frame-seal slide chamber (9x9 mm, SLF0201, Bio-rad) on the cover glass.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dkcg1","text":"Use a pipet to remove the excess PLL from the well and immediately replace it with   of filtered PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":83,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6uggb","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8bduo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"efqta","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"70","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7feg6","text":"It is important to always have liquid on top of the PLL-coated glass and not let it dry out.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"co7su","text":"Pipet   of 0.01% PLL (0.01% poly-L-lysine solution, P4707, Sigma-Aldrich) into the well and wait for  . The PLL will coat the surface of the cover glass.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":6,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":101,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"131tu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8828c","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2pbcl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"70","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"97us6","text":"Always use a freshly thawed aliquot of PLL. You can aliquot the PLL and store it in a -20 °C or -80 °C freezer.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d4m3m","text":"Use a pipet to remove the excess filtered PBS from the well and immediately replace with  filtered PBS. Gently pipet up and down in the corners of the well. Repeat this step 2 more times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":88,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dt2mb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"70","error":false,"guid":"5ED9D37AAEF811EEAB870A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4c1ue","text":"Use a pipet to remove the excess PBS from the well and immediately replace with   of   SYTOX Orange (S11368, Invitrogen). The SYTOX Orange molecules will stick to the surface of the PLL-coated cover glass.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":80,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":85,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eaur8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"1","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":30}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"684jm","text":"Image the sample straight away and make sure it doesn't dry out during imaging.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8ehi0","text":"In the meantime:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"apdnu","text":"Filter phosphate-buffered saline (PBS) using a 0.02 μm syringe filter (6809-1102, Whatman).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"84ae8","text":"Dilute SYTOX Orange (S11368, Invitrogen) in filtered PBS to a concentration of  .","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":79,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8tif4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1mn4l","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aukp0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"1","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":30}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3s22","text":"Always use a new aliquot of SYTOX Orange to prepare the 1 nM dilution, as dye doesn't store well at low concentrations.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

title: Imaging single SYTOX Orange molecules on a PLL-coated cover glass
